articles.title: Targeting the Uneven Burden of Kidney Disease on Black Americans - The New York Times
articles.description: New treatments aim for a gene variant causing the illness in people of sub-Saharan African descent. Some experts worry that focus will neglect other factors.
articles.content:

articles.title: Black adults raised in the South have greater risk of lower cognitive performance in later life - Medical Xpress
articles.description: Black adults who grew up poor and socially disadvantaged in the American South are more likely than white adults with a similar background to suffer cognition problems later in life, according to a Rutgers study.
